In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, ' ')  # Split string into array of words
    lines = String[]  # Initialize an empty array to store lines
    current_line = ""  # Initialise a variable for the current line

    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " $word") > text_width  # Check if adding this word exceeds the limit
            push!(lines, current_line)  # Add the current line to the list of lines and reset it
            current_line = ""  # Reset the current line for the next one
        end
        current_line *= " $word"  # Append the word to the current line
    end

    push!(lines, current_line)  # Add the final line to the list of lines

    return join(lines, '\n')  # Join all lines into one string with new-line characters in between
end
```
You can call the function like this:

```julia
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer nec odio. Vestibulum cursus"
println(wrap_string(s))
```
